User-Agent:       Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 8.0; Windows NT 6.0; WOW64; Trident/4.0; GTB6; SearchToolbar 1.2; SLCC1; .NET CLR 2.0.50727; Media Center PC 5.0; .NET CLR 3.5.30729; .NET4.0C; .NET CLR 3.0.30729)
Build Identifier: Testopia 2.4

As you enter test cases, "Automation" attributed is used (checkbox).
However I dont see its importance anywhere in the tool. 
Neither the test cases directly show if they are automated or not nor its considered as in a report criteria.  The only way is to filter everytime.

With our testing scope, having to know if a test case is automated or not upfront is highly essential. That way a tester when testing would know if a particular test case is automated or not. If automated - he would ignore and continue with the rest of the manual test cases.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Created a test case.
2.Checked the "automation" checkbox during test case creation.
3.Summary of the test case does indicate that the test case is automated - AUTOMATED - YES.
Actual Results:  
Do not see this attribute in any of the tables listed (test cases table or test runs table)

Expected Results:  
I would like to have a 
Automation attribute as part of the column in test cases list.

I would like to have a 
Automation attribute as part of the column in test cases list.
I have a screenshot explaining what should the software have done instead.
Unsure how to attach it to this bug.
